Articles.Content: It just keeps happening
+rep for Lem. Read only only one of his books, but it was pretty good. Once I finish Christine (by King, of course) I'm going to read another one of Lem's.

We have a room in our house that is nothing but books. Books in boxes, books on shelves. Books, books, books.

I love books.
I forgot to mention, I still have ten more on the way. This will probably increase, soon.

We have a room in our house that is nothing but books. Books in boxes, books on shelves. Books, books, books.

I love books.

Books, books, books, books. Books, books, books, books. Lovely Books! Wonderful Books! Lovely Books! Wonderful Books!

I'm actually worried, now. The mailbox is only so big. I may very well get like, nine or something arriving on monday, and I don't want to see any damaged by mailpeople jamming them into the mailbox haphazardly.

Well then, you need a bigger mailbox. Or a second one.

Anyways, am I the only one here who cast away the sci-if genera in favor of techno-thrillers?

Five more. Going to need to get Barlowe's Guide repaired sometime...

Also holy hell what sort of acid trip is the cover for The Gods Themselves

Oh lord help they keep coming

5 remain (I added 3 more to the queue...)

i have this problem, but since i read very quickly and devour reading materials voraciously, i have done something that far exceeds browsing a used book store.

i've gone to packages with 200+ recommended sci-fi books and downloaded them all onto my iPad. i carry around with me a digital library that is expanding to nearly a gigabyte and a half.

A while ago I finished reading Asimov's "The Gods Themselves".

It's my first english second-hand old sf-novel and I have to say: I'm hooked!

Three chapters but, the second one, Man! Really loved that second chapter. I've never read anything like it!

I think I'm in trouble...

I feel the need to bump this with a status report.

Since 9/1/15 I've read 34 books. Mostly from the library, though. Most recently, I've read The Martian. I've also read some Terry Pratchett.

I have most of those books. :)

Your collection needs more Roger Zelazny, Ursula K. LeGuin, Cordwainer Smith, Alan Dean Foster, David Brin, and Alfred Bester.

Meanwhile, Rendezvous with Rama finally came close to death...

[img]http://i.imgur.com/6KwtCDI.jpg[/img]

...and then dropped off its binding entirely.


So!

Begin the story of FrankenRama.

[img]http://i.imgur.com/Pxb09e3.jpg[/img]

I extracted the backing boards from the binding for re-use later. At this moment I've glued a cardboard splint onto the back of the split section of pages to patch the hole (it was hardcover but bound like a paperback) which is absolutely slathered in glue. Once that dries I should have what amounts to a paperback without covers. Then I can begin to think about cover materials. Maybe leather, if I can find some general purpose sheets...
